vision: create a mobile app called SuperSpouse, that allow couples to help and support each other in running a household or a family. System should allow a family member to basically start a family and invite family members to join, this will limit the visibility to who can access the family information. App should support offline use. App should make it easy to either log or request assistance with common household chores. Create an initial list of common household chores
scope: Create requirements for becoming a member, creating a family, adding members, logging or requesting chores and assigning, allow for the management of their own custom chore list

requirements.text: The system shall allow a user to create a personal account by providing an email address and password.
The system shall allow a user to create a family by providing a family name.
The system shall allow a user to invite other users to join their family by sending an invitation via email.
The system shall allow a user to accept or decline an invitation to join a family.
The system shall restrict access to family information to only members of that family.
The system shall allow a user to log a chore with a name, description, and estimated time to complete.
The system shall allow a user to request assistance with a chore by specifying the chore name and any additional details.
The system shall allow a user to assign a chore to another family member.
The system shall allow a user to mark a chore as completed.
The system shall allow a user to view a list of all chores assigned to them.
The system shall allow a user to view a list of all chores assigned to other family members.
The system shall allow a user to create a custom chore list for their family.
The system shall allow a user to add, edit, or delete chores from the custom chore list.
The system shall allow a user to view and manage their family's custom chore list.
The system shall allow the app to function offline, storing data locally until it can be synced.
The system shall allow the app to automatically sync data with the server when an internet connection is available.
The system shall provide a list of common household chores for users to select from when logging or requesting a chore.
The system shall allow a user to log their progress on a chore.
The system shall allow a user to set reminders for chores.
The system shall allow a user to view the completion status of all chores.
The application must collect and store the following user information: full name, gender, email, phone, and zipcode.
The application must support two types of family memberships: direct and indirect.
The application must store the type of family membership (direct or indirect) as an attribute of the user's profile.
The application must enforce a limit of 200 family members per user account.
The application must allow users to assign priority to chores with various time-based options.
Users can select from predefined time intervals (15 minutes, 2 hours) or manually enter a custom time in hours and minutes.
Users can set chores to be completed by the end of the day, by a specific date and time, immediately, or soon.
The application must confirm the user's selected time options before finalizing the chore priority.
The application must include a categorization system for chores.
The application must allow for the assignment of chores to individuals or groups.
The application must track the status and updates of chores.
The application must support the logging of detailed descriptions and expectations for each chore.
The application must allow for the specification of the type of chore (household, family, friends).
The application must include a feature to record the value or benefit of completing a chore.
The application must include a feature to manage a list of household chores, with the ability to add, edit, and delete chores from the list.
The application should allow users to prioritize and categorize chores within the list.
The application must include a feature to set and manage limits on the number of family members that can be registered or associated within the system.
The application must allow an unlimited number of chores to be set to 'immediately' or 'soon'.
Ensure the application can handle an unlimited number of chores with 'immediately' or 'soon' status without performance degradation.
The application must support setting an unlimited number of chores with 'immediately' or 'soon' priority, with a practical limit of 100-200 chores.
The application should be designed to handle up to 200 chores set to 'immediately' or 'soon' without any artificial limit imposed by the system.
The application must support setting an unlimited number of chores with the status 'immediately' or 'soon', with a practical limit of 100-200 chores.
The application must support setting a large number of chores (up to 100-200) with the priority 'immediately' or 'soon' without imposing a hard limit.
The application must allow users to set any number of chores to 'immediately' or 'soon' status, with a practical limit of 100-200 chores.

questions.text: What information should be required to create a personal account?
questions.answer: full name, gender, email, phone, zipcode

questions.text: Should users be able to have multiple family memberships?
questions.answer: yes, there should be direct and in-direct family members, there maybe features in the future that act differently based on this status

questions.text: How should the invitation process be designed to ensure user experience?
Should there be a limit on the number of family members?
What level of detail should be required when logging a chore?
questions.answer: A chore should be part of a category, a type (household, family, friends), has a value or benefit (saves time, convenance), who its assigned (a family member or group), description, details, expectations, status, updates

questions.text: Should users be able to prioritize chores?
questions.answer: yes, it should be time boxed, either by an actual time (simple hours:mins), in the next (15 mins, 2 hours, left you select quick buttons), let user select an interval mins/hours, and add to it by mins/hours), by end of day, by a given date and time, immediately, soon. User should be able to confirm what options they want

questions.text: What should be the default behavior for offline data syncing?
How long should data be stored locally before being synced?
What are the most common household chores that should be included in the initial list?
questions.answer: give me a list of 25 suggestions

What visual cues should be used to differentiate between different time priority options?
Should there be a limit to the number of chores that can be set to 'immediately' or 'soon'?
questions.answer: No there should be no limit, practical limit would be 100-200, we shouldn't limit the user however.

Tag system for multiple category assignments
Hierarchical tree view

questions.text: What database schema should be used to store the detailed attributes of chores?
options: Relational database with multiple tables linked by foreign keys
Document-based NoSQL database for flexible attribute storage
Graph database to represent relationships between chores and assignees
Column-family NoSQL database for scalability
Hybrid approach combining SQL and NoSQL elements

Polling with RESTful API
GraphQL subscriptions for efficient data fetching
MQTT for lightweight messaging

Descriptive text input for convenience
Predefined categories of benefits (e.g., time, money, health)
User-defined tags for custom benefits
A combination of quantitative and qualitative measures
